name: vscode-yls
description: A Visual Studio Code extension for YARA based on YLS (Yara Language Server).
author: Matej Kastak

yls.executablePath.description: Specifies an absolute path to the yls executable. If empty yls is expected to be in $PATH variable. (example: /home/user/yls/env/bin/yls)

yls.yari.samplesDirectory.description: Specifies an absolute path to the directory used to store samples and module data. Used only for local YARI. (example: /home/user/samples)

yls.snippets.metaEntries.description: A set of metadata entries to insert into rules. Empty values will create meta keys with a tabstop, and built-in variables are accepted (though transforms are ignored).

yls.snippets.sortMeta.description: Sort the metadata entries in alphabetical order by keys. Otherwise, insert keys as listed.

yls.snippets.condition.description: Enable the condition snippet on YARA rules. Has no effect on the presence of the condition section in the rule snippet.

yls.snippets.meta.description: Enable the meta snippet on YARA rules. Has no effect on the presence of the meta section in the rule snippet.

yls.snippets.rule.description: Enable the rule skeleton snippet on YARA rules. Settings for other snippets do not affect the sections provided in this snippet.

yls.snippets.strings.description: Enable the strings snippet on YARA rules. Has no effect on the presence of the strings section in the rule snippet.

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint
